The credential can be used towards a selected UNSW postgraduate program.

skills.name: Alignment Of Australia's Health System With Value-Based Healthcare
Critical Success Factors For Transitioning Towards Value-Based Healthcare

Multi-Disciplinary Teamwork For Operating Within Value-Based Healthcare Setting
Multiple Care Pathways Comparisons For Attaining Value Care
Patient Reported Measures Identification For Better Health Outcomes And Patient Experience
Project Planning & Group Presentation For Recommendations Towards Value-Based Healthcare Within Personal Injury Schemes

696e8ca1-c0e6-49a2-9b3a-878aee23d0be.description: Individuals who complete this course will develop a comprehensive view of effective operational risk management exploring how good operational risk management can be a business enabler, the emerging trends in operational risk management and the mindsets and behaviours of a future-focused risk practitioner. Candidates will be able to identify emerging risks, threats and opportunities, use system thinking to drive decisions and build a risk culture.
696e8ca1-c0e6-49a2-9b3a-878aee23d0be.name: CBA Operational Risk Excellence Program

badge_template_activities.title: Participating in 8 virtual learning sessions on operational risk management covering the following topics:  Risk Concepts and Frameworks, Taxonomy and Governance, Risk and Control in Business,  Risk Controls Self Assessment, Future of Risk, Business Enablement and Building a Positive Risk Culture.

Completing 4 self-paced learning modules on the topics: Operational Risk in Fin Services, Operational Risk in Practice Emerging Trends in ORM, Building a Positive Risk Culture and Operational Risk Management as a Business Enabler.

Participating in 4 professional development virtual learning sessions on the following topics: Decision Making, Collaborating for Outcomes, Influencing and Negotiating and Consulting Skills. Receive feedback from AGSM@UNSW Business School on evidence and reflection demonstrating sound understanding and application of the program concepts.

Submit evidence of how concepts from each module were applied in their day to day work along with reflections on how to continue to make a positive impact as a leader and on their team as a result of increased capability.

c34c188f-a21c-4a9f-8856-5c479612773d.description: The Heinz Harant Award is awarded annually to an individual who has shown exemplary volunteering within the Arc community. Heinz Harant was a WW2 refugee, who was in the fourth graduating engineering class of 1955. During his time at UNSW he was a kickass activist, and started many of the committees and councils on campus, focusing on everything that makes UNSW fair today. The Heinz Harant Award is a way in which the Arc community can recognise and honour the valuable and exemplary volunteers
c34c188f-a21c-4a9f-8856-5c479612773d.name: Heinz Harant Award

Leaders understand the importance of continuous environmental scanning to anticipate stakeholder needs and know how to provide experiences that are customer centric and beyond their expectations. Leaders are equipped with the skills to try multiple approaches to test innovative ideas and can encourage others to learn and adopt this way of thinking.
0165e004-187d-4b63-9f31-c4fdd57fd818.name: LEAD: Design Thinking

217e5165-4fab-4b82-a97b-a1cad30cbada.description: Individuals who complete this course, have practical toolkits and skill-sets to transition from individual contributors to people leaders. They demonstrate capabilities to increase their self-awareness to lead with more authenticity and build trusted relationships.
217e5165-4fab-4b82-a97b-a1cad30cbada.name: Leadership Fundamentals

b915a18b-44fc-43a6-b5a4-ad0cbe0a4788.description: Individuals who complete this course, are able to apply an adaptive leadership style to lead more effectively in remote working environments. Understand themselves as a leader & what drives you, your values & your unconscious biases to become a more human-centred leader. Maintain team performance & accountability through stronger collaboration, communication & relationships. Challenge existing work habits, building your ability to navigate uncertainty & respond to emerging challenges.
b915a18b-44fc-43a6-b5a4-ad0cbe0a4788.name: Leading for High Performance

badge_template_activities.title: Three weeks of live virtual workshops, action learning and coaching.

They are better equipped to coach, mentor and give feedback to their teams. Further, they can build on their current management toolkit to better motivate and engage others to maximize team and organisational performance, shaping a future positive performance culture.
61a80909-51df-4bca-95ea-5f9744048ee9.name: Leading for High Performance

e0a7fb32-a200-423f-8ed3-663dda844c3b.description: Individuals who complete this course, have a deeper understanding of the concepts of purpose, purpose-driven leadership and common reasons for ethical failures. They can use practical tools to engage in ethical thinking, decision-making and leadership. They can apply specific actions to accelerate their growth as ethical leaders who engage in purpose-driven leadership. They are able to develop, or revisit, their purpose, values and principles at the individual, team and organisational levels.
e0a7fb32-a200-423f-8ed3-663dda844c3b.name: Leading with Purpose and Ethics
